Topic.Title: More time off for the governmant parasites

Message.Msg: 4 years ago George W Bush was accused of being too much time on "vacation". Yeah. He spent few hundred days "vacationing"! In Crawford. Been there? Haven't seen this place on the list of recommended resorts. Who really wants to spend that much time in 100F heat? He never played golf after 9/11 either. Why? He felt it would be inapropriate. Our current president though beat all golfing records, spends his vacations .in the most extravagant places. And I souldn't complain. Cause our dear leader did such a darn good job? By doing exactly what? Sending extra 15 million to live on food stamps and driving the nation's debt to sky high levels. Well, of course none of that is his fault, it's always the other guy. But still, just a little modesty is too much to ask? He is spending our tax money, not his own. Oh, those millionaires. My boss makes a lot of money.What's his fault?

Message.Title: GM workers to get bonuses after 40 billion loss on stock buy back
Message.Msg: What a country! **GM workers can expect bonuses of between $5,500 and $7,000** Nice Bonuses For Ford, GM United Auto Workers’ Members Profit-sharing bonuses for United Auto Workers’ members at Ford Motor Co. (NYSE: F) and General Motors Co. (NYSE: GM) are expected to be at least as large as last year’s payout at General Motors and larger than the year-ago bonuses paid at Ford. Approximately 55,000 GM hourly workers and 40,000 Ford employees are in line for the payments. Ads by Google GM workers can expect bonuses of between $5,500 and $7,000, and Ford’s employees could receive a payment of more than $8,000 each, according to a report in The Wall Street Journal.

Topic.Title: GM workers to get bonuses after 40 billion loss on stock buy back

Message.Msg: Why not? Let GM go under so Obama become double GM savior! "Osama is dead, GM is double alive!". What can be easier and better for president's image? May be another financial collapse?
You mean blackneck stupid...dozens shot and killed every weekend in the hood.

Message.Title: Postal workers to go on self imposed diet
Message.Msg: Just what the doctor ordered....reduce the physical size of the overweight postal workers. **Postal workers continue hunger strike against proposed delivery cuts** Despite most of Congress leaving town for the holidays, postal workers are continuing a hunger strike protesting legislation to save the United States Postal Service (USPS) through budget cuts. The hunger strike began Tuesday and is expected to end late Saturday, according to The Washington Post. Six former and current postal workers, part of a group called Communities and Postal Workers United, are calling the strike “six days starving to save six-day delivery.” Their goal is to stop Congress from reducing postal delivery to five days a week. “We have to be on guard, to raise awareness and pressure the decision-makers as they wrangle back-room deals,” group spokesman Jamie Partridge, a retired letter carrier from Portland, said in a statement. The agency lost $16 billion in fiscal year 2012, and needs to cut around $22.5 billion from its annual budget by 2016.

Message.Title: Pig Chronicles
Message.Msg: Hello boys and girls,,, In the past, as I slammed,,,, ummmm, George,,,,, I recall saying for instance, that I was too old to ‘learn a new tap-dance’; that engineering ‘was my plan’; etc., blah, blah, blah,,,, Well, dammit, I went and learned a new ‘tap-dance’,,,, fer I was thinkin’ that I couldn’t dance at all,,,, alas,,,,,,,, Yep, here it is,,,, (((Drum-roll please))),,,, I went and got my CDL Semi Truck Driving License. (Breaker 1-9, breaker 1-9,,, can youz hear me,,,,????) Hahahahahahaha,,, Yepper, nowz all I have to do is find a job,,,, Ummmm, as some of you might have already suspected, the last job went up in smoke, yet I did put a schightpot full of cash in the bank before it did, thus I have a ‘new attitude’ for the near term while it lasts. Ok, ok,,, everybody slam me for whatever pathetic reason that ‘blows yer skirt up’. Anyway, it struck me as somewhat remarkable, the tap-dance thing, relative to my past ramblings,,,,,,,,,, Oh yeah, before I leave,,,, is E-turd at 35.50 yet?????? Yer friend, P
